name: Ali Siahkoohi
content: Ali Siahkoohi Background Assistant Professor, University of Central Florida (2025–present) Simons Postdoctoral Fellow, Rice University (2022–2025) Ph.D., Georgia Institute of Technology, Computational Science and Engineering (2022) M.Sc., University of Tehran, Geophysics (2016) B.Sc., Sharif University of Technology, Electrical Engineering (2013) Research My research focuses on uncertainty quantification in complex systems that arise in computational science and engineering, with an emphasis on deep generative modeling. By integrating deep learning and scientific computing, my group develops scalable sampling techniques for high-dimensional distributions. This work enables Bayesian inference in large-scale PDE-based inverse problems (e.g., seismic and medical imaging) and provides a principled framework for building reliable, uncertainty-aware AI models for real-world applications. Teaching Sampling Methods for Uncertainty Quantification (Spring 2026) Algorithms for Machine Learning (Fall 2025) Publications Preprints Improving fairness and mitigating MADness in generative models P.
